macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Fed Holds Rates Unchanged; S&P 500 Flat After Briefly Topping 7,000
items.summary: The Federal Reserve kept interest rates steady on January 28, leading to mixed US market closes: S&P 500 flat at 6,978.03, Dow up 0.02% to 49,015.60, Nasdaq up 0.2% to 23,857.45. Volatility rose with VIX at 16.35 amid elevated uncertainty and geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Microsoft Plunges 10% on Earnings Miss, Largest Daily Drop Since 2020
items.summary: Microsoft shares suffered their biggest one-day decline since 2020, falling 10% after disappointing earnings. The drop contributed to indecisive market movements following the FOMC decision.

items.title: Semiconductors Rally Led by Texas Instruments' Strong Outlook
items.summary: Texas Instruments surged 9.9% on upbeat data-center demand forecast, boosting Micron 6.1% and Intel 11.0%. AT&T rose 4.7% post-results with positive profit guidance.

items.title: Gold and Silver Flash Crash After Rally; Bitcoin Dips Below $85,000
items.summary: Metals saw wild swings with gold hitting $5,600 and silver $121 before a 10% profit-taking crash. Cryptocurrencies weakened as Bitcoin fell below $85,000 amid deleveraging flows.

items.title: Asian Markets Mixed; Hang Seng Surges 2.6% to 27,826.91
items.summary: Hong Kong's Hang Seng jumped 2.6%, Kospi gained 1.7%, while Japan's Nikkei was flat and Topix fell 0.8%. US Dollar weakened as weakest G7 currency amid Fed Chair speculation.

items.title: GE Vernova and Cruise Stocks Rally on Guidance; Lockheed Martin Breakout
items.summary: GE Vernova nears early entry after raising guidance; Royal Caribbean's outlook lifts cruise stocks like RCL and VIK. Lockheed Martin poised for breakout on Q4 results and THAAD deal.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Senate Agriculture Committee Advances Landmark Crypto Bill on Party Lines
items.summary: The Senate Agriculture Committee voted 12-11 along party lines to advance cryptocurrency market structure legislation, granting new regulatory authority to the CFTC for digital commodities. Democrats' amendments, including ethics provisions targeting Trump family crypto businesses, were rejected amid ongoing partisan tensions.

items.title: Senator Durbin Warns Against Repeating 2008 Mistakes with Unregulated Crypto
items.summary: Senate Minority Whip Dick Durbin criticized the Senate Agriculture Committee's partisan advancement of crypto market structure legislation, urging comprehensive regulation to avoid the 2008 financial crisis amid cryptocurrency's volatility.

items.title: NYSE's Ambitious Blockchain Plans for Tokenizing Stocks Face Skepticism
items.summary: The New York Stock Exchange announced plans to put thousands of stocks on blockchain, but Columbia Business School professor Omid Malekan dismissed it as hype lacking technical details, amid competition from startups like Securitize and fintechs like Robinhood.

items.title: XRP Holds Steady at $1.90 Amid Ripple Banking and ETF Buzz; Solana Sees Inflows
items.summary: XRP strengthened with price stability around $1.90, fueled by expectations for Ripple banking programs and potential spot ETFs. Solana recorded significant capital inflows in January 2026.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Meta Fuels Massive AI Spending with Strong Ad Revenue
items.summary: Meta Platforms reported better-than-expected holiday quarter revenue on January 28 and forecasted record 2026 AI infrastructure spending, supported by improvements in its advertising business for personalized targeting. Shares rose over 11% in extended trading amid CEO Zuckerberg's push for superintelligence.

items.title: Apple Acquires Audio AI Startup Q.ai
items.summary: Apple announced the acquisition of Israeli startup Q.ai on January 29, which specializes in artificial intelligence technology for audio applications.

items.title: AI Stocks to Watch: BigBear.ai, Hut 8, Tempus AI, Fluence Energy, SoundHound AI
items.summary: MarketBeat highlighted BigBear.ai, Hut 8, Tempus AI, Fluence Energy, and SoundHound AI as top AI stocks with high trading volume on January 29, focusing on their roles in decision intelligence, biometrics, and voice AI.

items.title: Insurers Plan Increased AI Investments in 2026 Despite Skills Gap
items.summary: Accenture's survey of 218 insurance executives shows 90% plan to boost AI spending next year, viewing it primarily as a revenue expansion tool.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: 52% of Game Developers Now View Generative AI Negatively for Industry
items.summary: The 2026 Game Developers Conference survey of over 2,300 professionals reveals 52% see gen AI as harmful, up from 18% in 2024, despite 36% using it for tasks like prototyping. Major publishers continue AI investments amid growing developer skepticism.[1][2][5]

items.title: Project: Gorgon Exits Early Access to Reach 1.0 Launch
items.summary: Indie MMORPG Project: Gorgon fully launches out of Steam Early Access with new character models, a new city, level 100 skill unlocks, and more, marking the end of its long development journey.[3]
items.source: The Ancient Gaming Noob, MMORPG.com, Massively OP

items.title: 2026 State of the Game Industry Report Highlights Layoffs, Unionization, and Engine Shifts
items.summary: GDC's survey shows widening layoffs, 82% unionization support among US developers (only 12% unionized), Unreal Engine surpassing Unity at 42% usage, and Steam Deck as a top platform interest. It also notes immigration policy impacts and overwork.[2][5]

items.title: Xbox Gaming Revenue Drops in Q2 2026 After Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Flops
items.summary: Microsoft's January 2026 earnings update reports a fiscal hit to its gaming division, with revenue declining following the underperformance of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7.[4]

items.title: GDC Announces Game Awards Finalists and Hideo Kojima Keynote
items.summary: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 leads Game Developers Choice Awards finalists with eight nominations; Off Kilter Walking Simulator tops Independent Games Festival with five. Hideo Kojima will deliver GDC's first keynote in five years.[2]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Karnataka Government Advances Innovation Act for Regulatory Sandbox
items.summary: The Karnataka government is developing a regulatory sandbox under its Innovation Act to support testing and development of emerging technologies in a flexible environment. The announcement was made at the 20th India Digital Summit in Bengaluru on January 29, 2026.

items.title: AlphaTON Capital Presents at WSB Redacted Live Event with Key Financial Updates
items.summary: AlphaTON Capital (NASDAQ: ATON) is presenting at the WSB Redacted Live Event in Miami Beach on January 29-30, 2026, highlighting $24.5M assets, $11M cash, and a $4M deposit for 576 AI GPUs. CEO Brittany Kaiser delivers a State of the Business keynote.
